title: Ohm's Law Calculation
description: Find the current through the circuit using Ohm's law. A 10V battery is connected to a 5Ω resistor. What is the current in amperes?
solution: The two resistors are in parallel, so use the formula I = V/R. Calculate the equivalent resistance first if needed. R_eq = (R1 * R2) / (R1 + R2). Then, I = V/R_eq.

title: Kirchhoff's Voltage Law
description: Given a closed circuit loop with a 12V source and two resistors of 4Ω and 8Ω in series, determine the voltage drop across the 8Ω resistor.
solution: Apply Kirchhoff's Voltage Law: the sum of the voltage gains equals the sum of the voltage drops in a closed loop.

title: Resistor Network Equivalent
description: Determine the equivalent resistance of the following resistor network: two 10Ω resistors in parallel, connected in series with a 5Ω resistor. Give your answer in ohms.
solution: For resistors in series, add them directly. For parallel, use 1/Req = 1/R1 + 1/R2 + ... and then take the reciprocal.

title: AC Circuit Impedance
description: Calculate the impedance magnitude of an RLC circuit with R=10Ω, L=0.02H, and C=100μF at a frequency of 50Hz. Round to the nearest ohm.
solution: Impedance Z = sqrt(R² + (X_L - X_C)²), where X_L = 2πfL and X_C = 1/(2πfC).

title: Transformer Turns Ratio
description: A transformer has 400 turns in its primary winding and 100 turns in its secondary winding. If the primary voltage is 240V, what is the secondary voltage?
solution: The voltage ratio equals the turns ratio: V_primary/V_secondary = N_primary/N_secondary.

title: Power Factor Correction
description: An inductive load draws 100kVA at 0.8 lagging power factor. What is the reactive power in kVAR that needs to be compensated by capacitors to achieve unity power factor?
solution: Use the reactive power equation Q = V²/X_C. Adjust the capacitance so that the reactive power compensates for the lagging power factor.

title: RC Circuit Time Constant
description: In an RC circuit with R=10kΩ and C=47μF, calculate the time constant in seconds.
solution: The time constant τ = RC, which indicates how quickly the capacitor charges.

title: RL Circuit Decay
description: In an RL circuit with R=100Ω and L=0.5H, how long (in milliseconds) will it take for the current to decay to 36.8% of its initial value?
solution: Current decay follows I(t) = I₀ * exp(-t/τ) with τ = L/R.

title: DC Circuit Power Calculation
description: A 12V DC source supplies 2A of current to a resistor. How much power (in watts) is dissipated by the resistor?
solution: Power can be calculated using P = I²R or P = V²/R, depending on the given values.

title: Diode Forward Bias
description: At what approximate voltage (in volts) does a silicon diode begin conducting current when forward biased?
solution: When forward biased, a diode begins conducting current after surpassing its threshold voltage (about 0.7V for silicon diodes).

title: MOSFET Saturation Region
description: For a MOSFET to operate in the saturation region, what relationship must exist between V_DS and V_GS - V_TH? Express your answer using these variables.
solution: In saturation, the MOSFET functions as a constant current source, where the drain current is relatively insensitive to the drain-source voltage.

title: 2-Input AND Gate Truth Table
description: What is the output of a 2-input AND gate when inputs A=1 and B=0?
solution: The truth table: 0 AND 0 = 0, 0 AND 1 = 0, 1 AND 0 = 0, and 1 AND 1 = 1.

title: Ideal Op-Amp in Negative Feedback
description: What is the voltage difference between the inverting and non-inverting inputs of an ideal op-amp in negative feedback configuration?
solution: An ideal op-amp in negative feedback will drive its output such that the voltage difference between the inverting and non-inverting inputs is nearly zero.

title: RC Low-Pass Filter Cutoff Frequency
description: Calculate the cutoff frequency (in Hz) of an RC low-pass filter with R=1kΩ and C=0.1μF.
solution: The cutoff frequency is given by f_c = 1/(2πRC).

title: Laplace Transform in RLC Circuit
description: What is the Laplace transform of the differential equation L(di/dt) + Ri + (1/C)∫i dt = V(t)? Express in terms of I(s), R, L, C, and V(s).
solution: Transform the circuit to the s-domain, solve the resulting algebraic equation, and then apply the inverse Laplace transform to return to the time domain.

title: Fourier Series Representation
description: For a square wave with amplitude 1 and period 2π, what is the coefficient of the first harmonic in its Fourier series expansion?
solution: Express the waveform as a sum of sine and cosine functions with coefficients computed over one period.

title: Bode Plot Analysis
description: What is the slope (in dB/decade) of the magnitude Bode plot for a first-order low-pass filter at frequencies well above the cutoff frequency?
solution: Examine the phase and gain margins on the Bode plot; positive margins generally indicate a stable system.

title: Circuit Simulation with SPICE
description: In SPICE, what command is used to perform a DC sweep analysis for a voltage source named Vin from 0V to 5V in steps of 0.1V?
solution: Model the circuit components in SPICE, set up simulation parameters, run the simulation, and analyze the voltage/current responses.

title: Thermal Analysis of an Electronic Component
description: A power transistor dissipates 5W and has a thermal resistance of 10°C/W. If the ambient temperature is 25°C, what is the junction temperature in °C?
solution: Use the formula ΔT = P × θ, where P is the power dissipated and θ is the thermal resistance.

title: Electric Field of a Charged Sphere
description: At what distance from the center of a uniformly charged sphere does the electric field strength become equal to that of a point charge with the same total charge?
solution: For points outside the sphere, treat it as a point charge: E = kQ/r², where k is Coulomb's constant.

title: Capacitance Calculation
description: Calculate the capacitance of a parallel plate capacitor with area 0.01m² and separation distance of 0.001m, using ε₀ = 8.85 × 10⁻¹² F/m.
solution: Use the formula C = ε₀(A/d), where A is the area and d is the separation distance.

title: Inductance of a Solenoid
description: Calculate the inductance of a solenoid with 1000 turns, length 0.5m, and cross-sectional area 0.01m², using μ₀ = 4π × 10⁻⁷ H/m.
solution: Use the formula L = (μ₀N²A)/l, where N is the number of turns, A is the area, and l is the length.

title: Magnetic Flux Calculation
description: Calculate the magnetic flux through a circular loop of radius 0.1m in a uniform magnetic field of strength 0.5T.
solution: Use the formula Φ = B * A * cos(θ), where A is the area of the loop and θ is the angle between B and the normal to the surface.

title: Faraday's Law of Induction
description: A coil with 200 turns is placed in a changing magnetic field that induces an emf of 0.5V. Calculate the rate of change of magnetic flux.
solution: Use Faraday's Law: ε = -N(dΦ/dt), where N is the number of turns and dΦ/dt is the rate of change of magnetic flux.

title: Lenz's Law Application
description: A magnet is moved towards a coil, inducing a current. What direction does the induced current flow according to Lenz's Law?
solution: The induced current will flow in a direction that opposes the change in magnetic flux through the coil.

title: Capacitor Discharge Time
description: Calculate the time it takes for a capacitor to discharge to 37% of its initial voltage in an RC circuit with R=1kΩ and C=100μF.
solution: The time constant τ = RC, and the voltage across the capacitor at time t is V(t) = V₀ * e^(-t/τ).

title: Nodal Analysis in Circuits
description: Using nodal analysis, find the voltage at node A in a circuit with two resistors (R1=10Ω, R2=20Ω) connected to a 12V source.
solution: Set up the nodal equations based on KCL and solve for the unknown voltages.

title: Thevenin's Theorem Application
description: Use Thevenin's theorem to find the equivalent voltage and resistance seen by a load resistor in a circuit with a 10V source and two resistors (5Ω and 10Ω) in series.
solution: Calculate the open-circuit voltage and the equivalent resistance looking back into the circuit.

title: Superposition Theorem Application
description: Apply the superposition theorem to find the current through a 10Ω resistor in a circuit with two voltage sources (5V and 10V) and two resistors (5Ω and 10Ω).
solution: Calculate the contribution of each source separately and then sum the results.

title: RLC Circuit Resonance
description: Calculate the resonant frequency of a series RLC circuit with R=10Ω, L=0.1H, and C=100μF.
solution: The resonant frequency f₀ = 1/(2π√(LC)).

title: BJT Common Emitter Configuration
description: In a common emitter configuration, if the base current is 10μA and the current gain (β) is 100, what is the collector current?
solution: The collector current I_C = β * I_B.

title: Operational Amplifier Gain Calculation
description: Calculate the gain of a non-inverting operational amplifier with R1=10kΩ and R2=100kΩ.
solution: The gain of a non-inverting op-amp is given by 1 + (R2/R1).

title: Nyquist Stability Criterion
description: Using the Nyquist stability criterion, determine if a system with a gain margin of 10dB and a phase margin of 45° is stable.
solution: A positive gain margin and phase margin indicate that the system is stable.

title: Zener Diode Voltage Regulation
description: A Zener diode with a breakdown voltage of 5.1V is used in a circuit. If the input voltage is 12V, what is the output voltage across the Zener diode?
solution: In reverse bias, the Zener diode maintains a constant voltage equal to its breakdown voltage.

title: Frequency Response of a System
description: Determine the frequency response of a first-order system with a time constant of 0.5s at a frequency of 1Hz.
solution: The frequency response can be calculated using the transfer function H(s) = 1/(τs + 1).

title: Signal Sampling Theorem
description: According to the Nyquist theorem, what is the minimum sampling frequency required to avoid aliasing for a signal with a maximum frequency of 1kHz?
solution: The minimum sampling frequency is twice the maximum frequency of the signal.

title: Nyquist Plot Analysis
description: Analyze the Nyquist plot of a system with a gain margin of 20dB and a phase margin of 60°. Is the system stable?
solution: A positive gain margin and phase margin indicate that the system is stable.

title: Signal-to-Noise Ratio Calculation
description: Calculate the signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) in decibels for a signal power of 100mW and noise power of 1mW.
solution: SNR(dB) = 10 * log10(P_signal/P_noise).

title: Phase Shift in RC Circuit
description: Calculate the phase shift introduced by a capacitor in an RC circuit at a frequency of 1kHz with R=1kΩ and C=100μF.
solution: The phase shift φ = -arctan(ωRC), where ω = 2πf.

title: Magnetic Field of a Long Straight Wire
description: Calculate the magnetic field strength at a distance of 0.1m from a long straight wire carrying a current of 5A.
solution: Use Ampere's Law: B = (μ₀I)/(2πr), where μ₀ is the permeability of free space.
